unit_learning_outcomes.description: Recognise key social impact issues that occur in planning practice
Research and discuss complex ideas about social change, social process and assessment of social impacts
Recognise ethical issues and risks in impact assessment
Identify and discuss ways of integrating social issues into planning discourse and planning decisions
Explain the practice and requirements of SIA in planning systems
Apply knowledge and key concepts from social impact assessment to critical evaluation of planning decisions

assessments.description: 2000 word review of a social impact assessment or similar document
1000 word report identifying social impact issues raised by a proposed project
Presentation of social impact issues in a form suited to an identified audience plus 600 word written commentary

data.description: Social impact assessment (SIA) is an important assessment tool with wide application in land use planning. This unit provides an introduction to and broad overview of SIA in urban and regional environments, and addresses both the processes needed to accomplish a diligent assessment and the resources available to inform the assessment process. Through the use of current case studies, the unit provides an insight into practical difficulties, common mistakes and ethical issues that are frequently encountered. Students will learn how to recognise and respond to these problems, apply social science research methods to impact assessment and present impact issues to non-specialist audiences.
